title: Software Engineer - Game Services
desc: Wolfjaw Studios is looking to expand its Game Services team in Troy, NY. As a part of this team, you will be responsible for developing and supporting key features in multiplayer games.About Wolfjaw StudiosWolfjaw Studios has two core competencies serving both large media companies and multiplayer game studios.Our game services team partners with game development studios and publishers to build cloud based services that provide the infrastructure to support core game services, web applications, and marketing activities. Wolfjaw partners with studios and publishers on creating enterprise level services that are unique to each customer needs.Over the years, our team has been trusted to build the systems that power some of the most popular modern multiplayer games. Wolfjaw is relied upon by our customers throughout all stages of the development process as well as during deployment and active operations. On our team, youll have the ability to innovate and invent, helping define the technical foundations of groundbreaking systems.Our immediate need is for engineers to join our Game Services Team.What We Are Looking For:Prior programming experience with Go, C, C++, or C#Experience with containerization and/or cloud-hosted servicesFamiliarity with web, database, and automation technologiesA strong understanding of testing methodologiesDemonstrated problem solving and debugging skillsUnderstanding software development life-cycle processesExperience with version control and build systemsA passion for software development not only in what you know today but what you are looking to learn going forward.Pluses:A passion for playing and making gamesExperience developing in the entertainment or video game industryIn plain English:We are looking for people with a passion for developing software. You have shipped a back end service or two. The ideal candidate will be a curious self starter. You should be willing to put in the time to figure things out but at the same time not afraid to consult the rest of the team for help when you need it. You can manage your own time. You believe in putting your head down and getting things done. At the same time, you know when its time to go home and enjoy your life.What You Get: Competitive salary and benefitsFriendly and supportive colleagues and managersRelaxed environmentOpportunity to make key technical decisions which help define the future of product and infrastructure developmentThe chance to apply your existing knowledge while gaining experience with cutting edge technology and methodologiesJob Type: Full-timePay: $65,000.00 - $100,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceFlexible scheduleHealth insurancePaid time offParental leaveProfessional development assistanceSchedule:Monday to FridaySupplemental Pay:Bonus payExperience:Go: 1 year (Preferred)C: 1 year (Preferred)C++: 1 year (Preferred)Work Location:One locationWork Remotely:YesWork Location: One location

title: Software Engineer II (Frontend), Money
desc:
As a Web Frontend engineer at Uber, youll create and maintain experiences across some of our 500+ web frontend properties, including marketing pages and signup flows, applications for our millions of riders, drivers and eaters, and our internal business and operations tools that manage our products and logistics worldwide. Youll have the opportunity to impact our core ridesharing business, as well as emerging products like UberEATS, Uber Freight, mapping and self-driving cars.
About the Role
As a Frontend Software Engineer on the Orders/Money team, you will be working on a mission-critical area focusing on making sure that our operations and business teams can be as effective and efficient as possible by building a unified commerce platform that is used by many globally, across functions, to support money flows, in and out, at Uber. Our customers and users depend on fast and reliable money movement and our teams play a critical role in making that happen. We believe that by leveraging technology and incredible talent, what this team builds differentiates our offering and will have an immensely positive impact on customer experience and our companys success.
What Yo'll Do
Will work with a team of engineers and product managers to develop tooling and systems for many different internal customers to gain insight and work with our core Money platform.
Will be on-call for critical services relied upon by thousands of internal users and indirectly many more customers.
Basic Qualifications
Bachelors degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or related field OR 1-year full-time Software Engineering work experience, WHICH INCLUDES 1-year total technical software engineering experience in one or more of the following areas:
API design
Modern javascript
Note the 1-year total of specialized software engineering experience may have been gained through education and full-time work experience, additional training, coursework, research, or similar (OR some combination of these). The year of specialized experience is not necessarily in addition to the years of Education & full-time work experience indicated.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience working with modern js framework
Demonstrated proficiency with UX
Static typing systems
Experience working in full stack environments
For Colorado-based applicants: Please refer to this role in our careers page for more details on your total compensation and benefits package. You can get there by clicking apply if youre not already on our careers site. #LI-Remote

title: Entry Level Software Engineer
desc: Opanga Networks is seeking a talented software engineer with the right aptitude and attitude to join our ever-expanding team. Opanga is a growing company on the cutting edge of network management technologies for wireless networks. Our team creates a variety products based on our core data delivery technology including next generation SDN / NFVapplications, mobile applications for API frameworks for Android and Back-end server systems and web applications.What should you expect as an Opanga Software Engineer?As a member of the Opanga team you will take design requirements and convert them to high quality JAVA/C++ code in a timely manner.You will work with a team of professional software engineers to deliver top-quality software to our end users. You will participate in the full life cycle of our products including design, development, code reviews, patent creation and write up, test and documentation.We asked our engineers what they loved about their roles at Opanga, and here is what they said:Contribute meaningfully to new and already-deployed business-critical network optimization solutions with a global reach.Coordinate the operations of new and existing customer deployments.Work closely with product owners to define the scope of work for upcoming releases.Develop high-performance, network-level software running on bare-metal and virtual environments.Evolve solutions for monitoring and management as well as big data sourcing, processing, and visualization.Build and improve both small and large scale testing tools, frameworks, and methodologies that support our products.Challenge yourself by exercising self-driven learning and team problem-solving on a daily basis.Cultivate a broad scope of technical and non-technical skills driven by a lively startup culture.Share findings, knowledge, and experiences with other team members.Flexible, friendly work atmosphereSome of the things you might find on an Opanga Networks employees resume include:Designed and implemented a scalable NFV deployment, using OpenStack for a high-performance network environment This design was used to deploy company optimization technology across multiple countries and millions of subscribers.Improved the build process to automatically deploy software onto virtualized infrastructure to perform a gamut of regression and performance tests using Jenkins, Ansible and OpenStack.Designed and implemented a rigorous black-box testing suite in Python for a C software library with hundreds of thousands of lines of code.This is just a small sampling of the tasks that youwill be met with on a daily basis at Opanga. Are you up for the challenge?Requirements: 0-2 years experience in software development utilizing JAVA/Javascript or C/C++A working knowledge of Python/Bash scripting and OS ManagementUnderstanding of object oriented coding,threading, synchronizationExcellent communication and interpersonal skillsTo apply for this position, please send a cover letter and resume.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:Software Development: 1 year (Preferred)Education:Associate (Preferred)Location:Seattle, WA 98104 (Required)Work authorization:United States (Required)Application Question:Will you now or in the future require sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H-1B visa status)?Work Location:One locationSchedule::Monday to Friday

title: newEmbedded Software Engineer (Junior)
desc: ABOUT BIONAUT LABSAt Bionaut Labs, we have embarked on a unique voyage inside the human body. We are developing miniature remote-controlled robots that can navigate through tissue and target key anatomic locations in the body, for therapeutic or diagnostic purposes.Bionaut Labs is creating our software team and is looking for an early-career embedded-systems engineer. This is an opportunity to create a game-changing medical system by using modern development practices and evolving a highly collaborative team environment.RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:Develop the safety-critical Bionaut mission software Write software primarily in Rust, and incorporate libraries of C and C++ code Develop test-first (TDD) with strong unit and integration testing Team with verification engineers to develop automated verification tests Using functional programming and object-oriented approaches Identify and champion best-in-class tools and approachesBe a part of creating a world-class development experience Work as a member of a collaborative development team, using Mob Programming.(Prior Mob or Pair Programming experience not required) Be a positive team member, fostering an open and psychologically safe culture Incrementally improve team approaches using retrospectives and experiments Learn frequently in group and individual activities; teach and mentor othersControl Bionaut hardware Work at the metal creating device drivers and interacting with an RTOS Collaborate with algorithm researchers and convert the mathematical research code into reliable and efficient production code Utilize electronics analysis tools, including logic and network analyzersCreate a safe and reliable device Participate in risk analysis activities Learn and apply safe-by-design approaches Participate and improve regulatory facing effortsQUALIFICATIONS Bachelors degree (or better) in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or another applicable Engineering or Applied Sciences discipline. Zero to five years of related experience developing device software.REQUIRED SKILLSLanguages C/C++ family languages Rust  willingness to learn; prior experience not required, but very nice to have Python  working knowledge neededDevelopment Approaches Functional Programming Object-Oriented ProgrammingDomain Embedded systemsTools & Technologies Register level at-the-metal driver development, including A/D & D/A Converters, and Serial protocols (I2C, SPI, RS-232/485) Working with a Real Time Operating System (ThreadX, FreeRTOS, etc) Embedded systems tooling, including some of: Logic analyzers, Network analyzers, OscilloscopeNICE TO HAVE SKILLSLanguages Functional programming language, such as Clojure, Haskell, Elm, OCaml, F#, SchemeDevelopment Approaches Test-Driven Development Behavior Driven Development (BDD) Domain Driven Design (DDD) Pair-Programming and/or Mob Programming Extreme ProgrammingDomain High-reliability and/or fault-tolerant embedded systems Regulated environments, Medical preferredTools & Technologies Embedded/Real-Time Linux  nice to have PI and/or PID control, and Kalman filters Digital Signal Processing Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery tools (Jenkins, Github Actions, etc) Real-time ethernet Other network technologies ARM M-series processors (STM32, etc) Medical imaging technology (DICOM) Active Object concurrency modelJob Type: Full-timePay: $80,000.00 - $150,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)Dental insuranceFlexible scheduleHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offRelocation assistanceVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridayCOVID-19 considerations:We follow all health regulations for Covid19, and are operating as an essential business (medical device company)Application Question(s):What is your GPA in the most recent degree you completed?Education:Bachelor's (Required)Willingness to travel:25% (Preferred)Work Location: One location

title: Software QA Engineer
desc:
At Siemens, we are always challenging ourselves to build a better future. We need the most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrows reality. Find out more about the Digital world of Siemens here: www.siemens.com/careers/digitalminds
Siemens EDA  A Siemens Business, is a global technology leader in Electronic Design Automation, providing software solutions that help engineers around the world design and manufacture new and highly innovative electronic products. Each year, our customers use our tools to push the boundaries of technology and physics in order to deliver smaller, faster and more reliable products that run the worlds high tech devices.
Position Overview
We are looking for a highly motivated software quality engineer to join the Calibre Design for Manufacturability (DFM) team, ensuring that our EDA software product remains the best in the industry. DFM is about developing closer associations between the design world and the manufacturing world. The goal is to help layout design engineers choose strategies that result in more manufacturable (higher yielding) layout configurations. Calibre YieldAnalyzer and YieldEnhancer provide a set of Standard Verification Rule Format (SVRF) statements and operations you can use to develop DFM rule files that use the same tools and processes that designers already use for standard Design Rules Checking (DRC).
Responsibilities
You will be part of a team responsible for testing, debugging and qualifying software releases and updates. Quality assurance responsibilities include:
Involved in the design, development, and execution of functional and regression tests used to measure correctness, robustness, performance, and overall quality.
Collaborate with senior software engineers, quality assurance specialists, marketing, and customer support professionals to help deliver timely product releases that meet our customers needs.
Provide all partners with appropriate regression reports in a timely manner.
Encouraged to take advantage of opportunities provided to improve technical and job related skills; such as developing additional product breadth and business skills!
Use your leadership and innovation, to develop procedures and tools needed to improve the QA process and assist developers in making design trade-offs and risk analysis assessments.
This position requires employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless they are granted a medical or religious exemption
Required Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience:
Technical degree in Electrical Engineering/Computer Engineering/Computer Science or equivalent.
Experience working in a Linux environment
Knowledge of software quality assurance processes and experience with maintaining regression test suites.
Self-motivated and able to work independently
Possess a positive, can-do demeanor and capable of balancing multiple QA projects effectively and simultaneously.
Preferred Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience:
Knowledge of a scripting language (Python, Perl, Tcl, etc.)
Exposure to EDA verification tools like Calibre DRC
Experience developing or testing products which were written in an object oriented language
Basic knowledge of IC manufacturing process flows
Experience with Calibre SVRF for DRC is a strong plus

If yo're reading this and questioning whether you should apply, apply! There's no such thing as a perfect candidate, and we don't expect you to check every box. We're passionate about the uniqueness that people like you bring to the table. The companies that we incubate are only as innovative as the breadth of lived experiences shared by the teams building them. We can't wait to read your application.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. title: newMRS Staff Software Engineer
desc:
Job Profile Summary
Model Runtime Service (MRS) is a grid-based distributed computation environment responsible for running mission-critical pricing and risk calculations using our proprietary pricing libraries. The implementation platform chosen for MRS is Microsoft HPC on AWS. Development is mainly done with C# .NET framework, JavaScript and Ansible. We are looking for an experienced C# developer to take a lead position in the ongoing development and DevOps activities of MRS.

Job Advert
Key Accountabilities
Work within a business facing development team to deliver new solutions to the front office teams across internal businesses such as Oil, International Gas and North American Power & Gas
Monitor and intervene as needed during the day and the End-of-Day (EOD) process to ensure MRS is 100% available to internal customers
Work with other developers, quantitative analysts, and business users as part of a wider team
Contribute to analysis, design and development of systems, business processes, and user interfaces
Essential Education
Computer Science or other technical (e.g., Physics, Engineering) degree or equivalent commercial experience
Essential Skills/Experience
Exceptional development skills in C# and .NET platform
Professional experience with frontend development technologies (JavaScript, TypeScript, Angular, etc.)
Demonstratable experience in cloud environments provisioning (AWS, Azure, etc.) using public APIs
Experience with Linux and Microsoft HPC environments
Confident in writing and debugging concurrent and multithreaded services on .NET platform in a distributed computing environment
Strong understanding and hands-on practice of object-oriented programming, design patterns and software development best practices
Desirable Criteria
Experience with continuous integration tools such as (Jenkins, TeamCity, Ansible)
Experience in working with (or using) C++ native libraries is a big PLUS
Good understanding of pricing and risk calculations concepts in derivatives world is a big PLUS.
Previous experience working with the development and DevOps of similar grid-based distributed systems is a big PLUS
Experience of Agile methodology and the full development cycle
Why join us?
At bp, we support our people to learn and grow in a diverse and exciting environment. title: Jr Software Engineer - Backend
desc:
About the role:
Collaborates with stakeholders within the team to build and maintain backend services and solutions to support user-facing products, downstream services, or infrastructure tools and platforms used across Uber.
About the Team:
Whether engineering more accurate ETAs or helping drivers navigate to the perfect pick-up spot, our mapping technologies are integral to the magic of the Uber platform. On the Maps Engineering team, we use the latest ML, GPS, and telematics solutions. We run Big Data pipelines and maintain services that serve tens of thousands of requests per second. This is all to make transportation on our platform safer and more accessible!
Whenever you see a map, get an ETA, see the route a driver or courier is taking, or get picked up at the right location in an Uber product, it is being powered by the Maps Engineering team. We have multiple roles across Maps including Basemaps, Geofences and Tolls and Surcharges. As a part of the team, yo'll have a chance to work on the systems that are at the core of the services Uber provides. Your work will directly impact the millions of people who rely on Uber each and every day!
Minimum qualifications:
Bachelors degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or related field OR 1-year full-time Software Engineering work experience, WHICH INCLUDES 1-year total technical software engineering experience in one or more of the following areas:
Programming language (e.g. C, C++, Java, Python, or Go)
Note the 1-year total of specialized software engineering experience may have been gained through education and full-time work experience, additional training, coursework, research, or similar (OR some combination of these). The year of specialized experience is not necessarily in addition to the years of Education & full-time work experience indicated.
Technical skills:
Preferred:
Scalability engineering
Distributed systems
Product engineering
Experience with any of the following: scalable, systems and services; SQL/NoSQL data stores like MySQL, HBase, Cassandra, HDFS; Spark, EMR, S3; messages queues like Kafka; geo-replication and consistency/availability trade-offs; and service-oriented-architectures.
Experience or passion for working on systems related to maps
For Colorado-based roles: The salary/hourly rate range for this role is $123,930 per year - $137,700 per year. You will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award, commissions, & other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details about our company benefits can be found at the following link: https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits.
Please refer to this role in our careers page for more details on your total compensation and benefits package. You can get there by clicking apply if youre not already on our careers site.

title: Data Scientist
desc:
Overview:

Are you looking for a role where you can directly influence an organizations business strategy? Do you have a knack for solving problems? Do you want to help drive the results of a multi-million-dollar business? If so, you may have found your next role.
We are looking for a self-motivated individual to join our Data Science team to manage the information flow for our organization, including the integrity, efficiency, and availability of data. You will participate in day-to-day design, developing, validating and implementing production scale machine learning and data science models as well as taking an ownership of the model lifecycle. This role will also require developing credible and trusting relationships with senior leaders, managers and employees across the organization. Intellectual curiosity, ownership, and detail-orientation are requirements for the role and the department.
Responsibilities:
Formulate business objectives for the model building purposes
Collect and refine data from various data sources
Conduct exploratory data analysis of considered dataset and identify areas of data validation, quality improvement via cleaning, filtering and applying statistical techniques of numerous bias treatments
Develop, implement, numerous experimental and proof of concept approaches for the task
Be a continuous learner and willing to innovate and bring the latest cutting-edge approaches within the area of algorithms, model designs and model building
Partners with and interact with Analytics, Technology teams as well as business stakeholders
Partner with IT to create methods for monitoring, troubleshooting, and resolving data and model issues
Create and maintain production scale complete model pipeline
Manage periodic model production runs and be responsible for the ultimate results produced
Maintain model data documentation, data dictionaries, etc.
Qualifications:
Basic Qualifications:
Masters or PhD degree in STEM a plus, or equivalent experience
~3-5 years of relevant experience in analytics, finance, and/or IT
Strong technical skills and proficiency in Python programming, machine learning, deep learning, statistical analysis; Bayesian and causal analysis is a big plus
Ability to manipulate large datasets in a SQL in cloud Service environment is a must
Close familiarity and experience with Microsoft Azure is a plus
Experience to provide solutions on the scale of Big Data in PySpark or Scale is a big plus
Strong analytical skills and proficiency in problem solving; ability to formulate a problem statement, identify and QC needed inputs, and produce and visualize the right outputs is a must
Strong modelling skills and proficiency in relational databases; ability to create new data systems and improve existing ones is a must.
Familiarity with Non-SQL and Graph databases is a plus
Familiarity with Knowledge Graphs and understanding Semantic technologies is a plus
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience in building production scale models in cloud environment is a big plus
Familiarity with key languages, such as SQL, Python, PySpark, R
Familiarity with Microsoft Azure Platform products: Azure Synapse, AzureML
Proficiency in data modelling and data visualization tools, such as Power BI, Tableau, Matplotlib
Proficiency in juggling multiple deadlines and managing multiple clients / stakeholders
Proficiency in solving problems while being attentive to details
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Ability to make the complex simple, and explain model and data through stories
Experience with financial services is a plus
A Little About Strategic:
Strategic Financial Solutions is an award-winning financial services firm dedicated to helping people live a financially healthy life through the products and services we offer.
We were recently named as one of the Best Companies to Work for in New York State for the 5th time. Additional honors include being named, two times, as one of the 50 fastest growing companies in New York City and to the prestigious Inc. 500 list as one of the 500 fastest growing companies in the United States. Strategic is 100% employee owned, has offices in Manhattan and Buffalo, to house our rapidly growing family of over 900 associates. In June 2021 we proudly celebrated our 14th anniversary.
Strategic is committed to hiring, training, cultivating, promoting, and celebrating an environment where we have a welcoming and fulfilling place for all people to call home. Diversity of race, thought, sexual orientation, age, veteran status, religion, and disability will empower us to thrive as individuals, as teams, and as a company.
LI - Remote

title: Data Scientist
desc:
We are adding a Data Scientist to our growing team!


ABOUT AMERICAN CAPITAL GROUP

American Capital Group is a fully-integrated real estate development company. Over the last 33 years, our company has developed and built more than 80 multifamily properties across twelve states. We remain an industry leader because we know and manage internally Engineering and Design, Acquisition, Development, Construction, Property Management, and Asset Management. We strongly value teamwork, integrity, transparency and producing the highest quality of product for our investors and customers.


SUMMARY:

As Data Scientist at American Capital Group (ACG), your role is to be a pioneer and "discover," collect, process and analyze data with the end goal of making conclusions and recommendations that drastically improve the business. You will bring advanced technology to our industry (development, construction, and acquisition), which historically has been slow to adapt.

Individuals who thrive at ACG exhibit the following success skills  Collaboration, Critical Thinking, Innovator, Leadership, Energetic, Emotional Intelligence and Intellectual Curiosity, and Results Focus.


QUALIFICATIONS:

5-7+ years of experience in a data analysis environment.
Strong SQL skills. Must have the ability to write complex, highly-optimized queries across large volumes of data
Relational database management skills
Solid Python programming skills to create pipelines to cleanse and manipulate data
Strong ability with Tableau and Excel
Working knowledge of CRM systems
Excellent oral and written communication skills, and comfort presenting
Curiosity and passion about data, visualization and solving problems
Creativity to determine the best solution for a real-world problems
Willingness to question the validity, accuracy of data and assumptions
Drive and self-reliance, Eagerness to learn, Enjoyment of collaboration
Bachelors Degree
Ability to be an independent worker with a team player attitude.
All candidates must be able to speak, write, and understand English to qualify for this position.


RESPONSIBILITIES:

(Included but not limited to)

Designing and maintaining data models in support of business objectives
Create dashboards, reports, visualizations and algorithms to solve interesting business problems and questions.
Creating ETL pipelines using SQL, SSIS and Python
Understanding your business stakeholders' objectives, the metrics that are the most important to them, and how they measure their performance.
Use predictive modeling, regression analysis and other statistical analysis tools to evaluate data and form conclusions/projections
Finding and understanding the correct data sources for a given requirement
Investigate a hypothesis, reach data driven conclusions and make recommendations
Create dashboards and visualizations using Tableau or other
Performs other duties as assigned
All candidates must be able to speak, write, and understand English to qualify for this position.


LOCATION: Bellevue, Washington - 100% on-site position

JOB TYPE: Full-Time/Exempt

CORE BUSINESS HOURS:: Monday - Friday 7:00am - 4:00pm

(Additional hours and weekend days may be needed to work based on the business needs of the company)

SALARY: $150,000/year (DOE)


PRE- EMPLOYMENT SCREENING:

Candidates selected for hire must be able to pass a pre-employment/post-hire drug screen, and background checks along with taking a personality assessment.


AMERICAN CAPITAL GROUP IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER/ AFFIRMATIVE ACTION EMPLOYER

All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, disability, sex, age, ethnic or national origin, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or presentation, pregnancy genetics, veteran status, or any other status protected by state or federal law.

title: newData Scientist Associate-CXI
desc:
Data Scientist Associate-CXI
Long Beach, CA
Full-time
About SCAN
As one of the nations largest not-for-profit Medicare Advantage plans, serving more than 200,000 members in California, SCAN Health Plan has been a mission-driven organization dedicated to keeping seniors healthy and independent for over 40 years. SCAN employees are passionate about what they do, and understand that success is based on achieving the mission. Employees are afforded with the training and tools necessary to do their jobs and are rewarded for their efforts and recognized as experts in their fields. To learn more, visit scanhealthplan.com or follow us on social media: LinkedIn; Facebook; and Twitter.
The Opportunity
This role supports SCANs Customer experience and insights (CXI) function. The Data Scientist I will support SCANs analytical efforts to improve the Voice of the Customer using NLP and Predictive Modeling. This role is responsible for end-to-end development and analytics. The Data Scientist I will collaborate with both business and IT leaders to ensure best practices in driving value for our members from data.
You Will
Develops Topic Models using NLP for Key topics prioritized by the CXI committee for ongoing tracking as a part of the VOC Monitoring efforts.
Supports business discussions of Topic Model outputs to encourage adoption of VOC monitoring topics built by Data Scientist I
Cleans, processes, and identify areas of improvement for data sets of structured and unstructured data the capture member voice
Identifies organization strengths and weaknesses with respect to Data, Analytics, and Insights. Suggests areas of opportunity to support the initiative goals based on this context
Connects structured and unstructured data across the organization quickly to provided time sensitive data insights. Data sources including operational data, prospect data, call center data, core admin data, provider data, VOC data, clinical data, and external data.
Delivers Visualizations of relevant analyses to support business understanding
Develops Advanced analytics solutions for D&I use cases
Plans, organizes, and prioritizes assigned projects, creating and managing work plans that reflect the tasks, timeframes, and processes required to successfully complete each project.
Communicates effectively with various internal stakeholders and applies project standards.
Actively supports the achievement of SCANs Vision and Goals.
Other duties as assigned
Requirements
Your Qualifications
Bachelors degree in a relevant field required.
Master's degree preferred.
2+ years of experience in analytics and machine learning or graduate degree covering the same topics.
1+ years of working with Healthcare data preferred.
Ability to develop analyses and models independently.
Ability to document processes and analyses for reference/re-use.
Demonstrated understanding in the areas of big data, analytics infrastructure, cloud computing, data management, customer experience (CX) from a business analyst perspective.
Seeks and participates in development opportunities above and beyond required training.
Strong organizational and time management skills.
Covid-19 Vaccination Policy
To ensure a healthy and safe work environment, all SCAN employees will be required to be fully vaccinated by January 1, 2022. Generally, you are considered fully vaccinated 14 days after receiving the last dose, as recommended by the manufacturer, of a vaccine that has been authorized by the FDA for use in the United States, including vaccinations that have been approved pursuant to an Emergency Use Authorization. If fully vaccinated outside of the United States, the vaccination must be listed for emergency use by the World Health Organization (WHO). If you cannot receive the vaccine because of a disability/medical reason or sincerely-held religious belief, you may request an accommodation to this requirement by contacting COVID-19@scanhealthplan.com. Learn more about the COVID-19 vaccination here - https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/index.html.
What's in it for you?
A competitive compensation and benefits program
An annual employee bonus program
Robust Wellness Program
Generous paid-time-off (PTO)
Ten paid holidays per year, plus 1 additional floating holiday
Excellent 403(b) Retirement Saving Plan with employer match
Robust employee recognition program
Tuition reimbursement
A work-life balance
An opportunity to become part of a team that makes a difference to our members and our community every day!
We're always looking for talented people to join our team! Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply now!
At SCAN we believe that it is our business to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects our community through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more.
SCAN is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action workplace. Individuals seeking employee will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or any other status protected by law. A background check is required.

title: newSenior Data Scientist, Emerging Areas Open to remote work, e...
desc:
Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team

NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the worlds best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. its about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.
WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR
We are looking for an entrepreneurial, product-minded data scientist who is passionate about working on novel applications of data science within Nikes. Examples of emerging areas include data science for digital product design, interactive retail experiences, and sports marketing. The goal is to lay the foundation over the next few years for leveraging data and data science at scale within these spaces.


WHAT WILL YOU WORK ON
In this role, you will
Contribute to all stages of model development, from creating proof-of-concepts and beta testing, to partnering with data engineering, machine learning platform, and product teams to deploy algorithms, evaluate the A/B test results and deliver value in alignment with roadmap and business needs.
Strive to constantly improve model performance using insights from rigorous offline and online experimentation.
Adhere to software engineering best practices and contribute to shared code repositories.
Document modeling work and present to stakeholders and other technical and non-technical partners.
Participate in the broader data science community within Nike, including data science labs, study groups and team activities.
WHO WILL YOU WORK WITH
You will be a member of the Emerging Areas Data Science team. This team is part of Nikes Consumer Data Science team and Insights function. So you will be a member of the broader data science team at Nike, and participate in our data science labs, study groups, team activities, and attend conferences.
WHAT YOU BRING



3+ years of demonstrated experience developing and delivering effective machine learning and/or statistical models to serve business needs. Will accept suitable combination of education and experience.
Experience developing models for production scale highly desirable.
Proficiency in Python required.

Excellent data wrangling skills. SQL required. Working knowledge of Spark is a plus.

Expertise in recommender systems and e-commerce is highly desired.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively cross-functionally required.
Experience presenting to both technical and non-technical audiences and a history of publications or presentations at conferences is a plus.
A degree in computer science, statistics, applied math, physics, or other quantitative discipline, (Masters or PhD). Will accept suitable combination of education and experience
Open to remote work, except cannot work in Colorado, South Dakota, Vermont, and West Virginia. These candidates will be required to relocate.
NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world.
NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.

title: Geospatial Data Scientist
desc: Geospatial Data Scientist Geospatial Data ScientistEpochGeo is looking for a Geospatial Data Scientist to support one of the most innovative, exciting, and growing offices that is rooted in geospatial analytics in the national security space.Are you a technical geographer who loves to work with data, find patterns in it, and then turn it into actionable intelligence? Are you a data scientist who loves to draw out insights from data, and work with analysts and engineers to turn those insights into automated workflows? If so, please reach out to us at EpochGeo to chat.Location-based big data can be overwhelming, inaccessible, and noisy. EpochGeo is a data services firm specializing in supporting the full spectrum data cycle: beginning with scalable data storage, building algorithms or workflows, and ending with impactful analytics. Our developers, analysts, and data scientists have a proven track record applying open-source innovative technology, data science, and actionable analytics to inform customers data driven decisions.Your background likely includes: 2 - 5+ years of experience working in data analytics, data science -- to include, geospatial modeling, predictive analysis, time series analysis, machine learning, and/or AI.Education or military experience in Geography, Data Science, Computer Science, Economics, Mathematics, or Statistics.Must have Python or R, and SQL experience, and have experience applying it to client requirements.Experience with large volume geospatial data, multi-INT analytics, or automated analytics.Intel Analyst Experience in any of the following disciplines is a plus: open source exploitation, targeting, geospatial intelligence products, or statistical analysis.What you will be doing: Work with multiple data information types to; deconstruct key questions, leverage spatial data, exploit APIs, recommend methodologies, and develop algorithms.Create automated workflows or algorithms and machine learning models from big data to discover insights.Collaborate with software engineers to implement distributed/scalable algorithms.Exploit multiple geospatial big data environments for insights that can be automated at scale.Bonus: Professional Certificate or Masters degree in Data Science, Geography, Mathematics, etc.Additional: Must hold a DoD TS clearanceBenefits Include: Health care, FSA, HSA401k: 6% match, immediate vesting14 holidays: All 11 Federal holidays, day after Thanksgiving, 24 DEC, 31 DECPTO: 4 weeks annually3 week sabbatical every 3 years with the companyJob Type: Full-timePay: $145,000.00 - $175,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceFlexible scheduleFlexible spending accountHealth insuranceHealth savings accountLife insurancePaid time offReferral programRetirement planVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftSupplemental Pay:Bonus payEducation:High school or equivalent (Required)Experience:Python: 2 years (Required)SQL: 1 year (Preferred)Security clearance:Top Secret (Required)Work Location: Multiple Locations
